H0.text: Ethanol reduces air pollution because its combustion produces only water and carbon dioxide, which is why Brazilians have used ethanol‑gasoline mixtures since the 1970s, again in the 1990s, and recently again to conserve gasoline supplies and lower harmful waste products.

H1.text: Increases biodiversity is why ethanol is a good alternative fuel, because it is made from plants such as sugarcane and corn, burns cleanly to produce only water and CO₂, reduces harmful waste when blended with gasoline, and has historically helped Brazilians conserve gasoline supplies in the 1970s and again recently, thereby supporting environmental and biodiversity benefits.

H2.text: Reducing sound pollution is a benefit of ethanol, a plant‑based alcohol made from sugarcane and corn that burns to produce only water and CO₂, and when mixed with gasoline has been used in Brazil since the 1970s to conserve gasoline and lower harmful waste.

H3.text: Increases ozone emissions is the reason ethanol is considered a good alternative fuel.

A4.text: Ethanol is eco-friendlier and produces less greenhouse emissions upon combustion due to more complete combustion as compared to gasoline, leading to less toxic gases emitted, making it an eco friendly alternative.

A5.text: Since 1976 the Brazilian government has made it mandatory to blend ethanol with gasoline, and since 2007 the legal blend is around 25% ethanol and 75% gasoline (E25).
